titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Government Affairs Foundation records FA1159

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 16:54:42 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Government Affairs Foundation records

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two record groups by accession.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection in so far as it holds them, and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records of the Government Affairs Foundation were donated to the Rockefeller Archive Center in 1981. The Rockefeller Family Archives (Room 5600) received the records that comprise Record Group 1 from the Government Affairs Foundation in 1968 and 1969. The Record Group 1 files were received by the Rockefeller Archive Center in 1981 and were accessioned on February 6, 1981 as Accession 1981:006.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: The administration, finance, personnel, projects and studies records were initially appraised in June 1968. The publication and minute books were initially appraised in June 1969.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection is primarily comprised of project files, surveys, conference proceedings, studies, reports, administrative files, and a selection of vital records including meeting records, minutes, documents of record, and dissolution documents.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Record Group 1 is open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged materials may be restricted at the discretion of RAC. Record Group 2 remains restricted pending further processing.

did.unittitle: Accession 1981:006

physdesc.extent: 19 standard record storage boxes and 2 letter document boxes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Record Group 1 is arranged in six series as follows:
Series 5: Minutes and Documents of Record

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection is primarily comprised of project files, surveys, conference proceedings, studies, reports, administrative files, and a selection of vital records including meeting records, minutes, documents of record, and dissolution documents.
